intro: Asplenium adiantum-nigrum var. microdon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved maidenhair fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is native to various regions in Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a slender, lance-shaped appearance. The spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds, which are covered in small, rounded structures called sorus.
